fields.description:
The Activity Stream shows the tag *Yesterday* for activities performed between 24 and 48 hours before, but it is not totally right.
The tag *Yesterday* should be applied only to those activities performed between the midnight and the midnight of the day before.

You can see an example in the attachment: today is Friday and the Activity stream is showing different time tags (‘Yesterday’ and ‘Wednesday’) for activities performed during the same day (Wednesday) because it is counting yesterday starting from the 48 hours before. When you go to the ‘View issue’ screen of an issue tagged as ‘yesterday’ it shows the right date (Wednesday, which is not yesterday).
fields.summary: Inappropriate definition of 'Yesterday' in the Activity Stream

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-26480].
  {panel}

I'm using an EventListener to try to automatically transition issues in particular states, of particular types and for particular deployment environments (a custom attribute of the issue) to subsequent states.

The logic is failing, though, because the workflow entry associated with the issue is still in the CREATED state, not the ACTIVATED state.

I need a way to be notified when the workflow entry associated with an issue has been activated, because the time of the issue's creation is apparently too early.

I'm willing to implement a workaround, maybe even one that can be incorporated in some form into the JIRA codebase in the future, but I have to find a way to do this.

Is there a way for me to register a wrapper delegate for the WorkflowStore interface that gets used instead so that I can enable the registration of listeners to this store and so that I can make sure that these listeners are called when either createEntry() or setEntryState() is invoked?

I saw that OSWorkflow has WorkflowListener and WorkflowLocalListener, but these require you to implement EJBs.

And I tried a work-around that was documented below, but temporarily turning on indexing made no difference:

http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?messageID=257303594

Here is my related question on Atlassian Answers:

https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/24245/why-is-jira-saying-that-a-perfectly-valid-transition-for-my-issue-is-invalid
fields.summary: Cannot transition an issue upon its creation, because its workflow entry is still not active

fields.description:
When creating a new subscription for a filter, add a job with the following cron expression: 
{code}
0 0 * * * ? * 2,3,4,5,6
{code} 
The job can be successfully created (as in the screenshot creation.png), but when we edit, it throw a system error(detail in the file cron_error) like :
{noformat}
Cause:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: The provided cron string does not have 7 parts: 0 0 * * * ? * 2,3,4,5,6

Stack Trace: [hide]

java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: The provided cron string does not have 7 parts: 0 0 * * * ? * 2,3,4,5,6
at com.atlassian.jira.web.component.cron.parser.CronExpressionParser.parseCronString(CronExpressionParser.java:322)
at com.atlassian.jira.web.component.cron.parser.CronExpressionParser.parseAndValidateCronString(CronExpressionParser.java:305)
at com.atlassian.jira.web.component.cron.parser.CronExpressionParser.<init>(CronExpressionParser.java:75)
at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.filter.FilterSubscription.doDefault(FilterSubscription.java:107)
at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
{noformat} 

It looks like the Cron expression will only check the first 6 components, if they're OK, the job can be create even the expression is illegal for example: 
{code} 
0 0 * * * ? * 2,3,4,5,6 8
0 0 * * * ? * 2,3,4,5,6 8 11 21
....
{code}

The only workaround solution is to delete the job.
fields.summary: Cron expression check bug

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-26469].
  {panel}

The CHANGED operator is JQL is very useful, but adding a NOT CHANGED operator would be very beneficial as well.

For example: 'status = "In Progress" AND status NOT CHANGED AFTER "-7d"' to find issues which are effectively stalled.

This is useful for teams implementing continous flow processes like KANBAN. Combined with the Greenhopper rapid board and quick filters a NOT CHANGED operator could help quickly hightlight things stalled on the board.

This behaviour can be simulated with current JQL by combining status WAS and status CHANGED, but this has to be specified for each status to observe, which is very hard to maintain when you have a more complex workflow.
fields.summary: Add NOT CHANGED operator to JQL

fields.description:
This is a problem that causes emails to get stuck in the pop server and arises when there is a splitregex setting in the handler params for mail services and the email has an empty body and attachemnt. 

h5. The error
{code}
2011-11-23 23:42:05,252 QuartzWorker-0 WARN ServiceRunner    POP3 Service [com.atlassian.mail.MailUtils] Unable to extract text from MIME part with Content-Type 'application/msword;
	name="FINAL IDDI Manual September 2010 (2).doc"
2011-11-23 23:42:05,299 QuartzWorker-0 WARN ServiceRunner    POP3 Service [service.util.handler.RegexCommentHandler] Failed to split email body. Appending raw content...
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.apache.oro.text.regex.PatternMatcherInput.<init>(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.oro.text.perl.Perl5Util.split(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.oro.text.perl.Perl5Util.split(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.jira.service.util.handler.RegexCommentHandler.splitMailBody(RegexCommentHandler.java:46)
	at com.atlassian.jira.service.util.handler.RegexCommentHandler.getEmailBody(RegexCommentHandler.java:35)
	at com.atlassian.jira.service.util.handler.AbstractCommentHandler.handleMessage(AbstractCommentHandler.java:78)
	at com.atlassian.jira.service.services.mail.MailFetcherService.run(MailFetcherService.java:186)
	at com.atlassian.jira.service.JiraServiceContainerImpl.run(JiraServiceContainerImpl.java:60)
	at com.atlassian.jira.service.ServiceRunner.execute(ServiceRunner.java:47)
	at org.quartz.core.JobRunShell.run(JobRunShell.java:195)
	at com.atlassian.multitenant.quartz.MultiTenantThreadPool$MultiTenantRunnable.run(MultiTenantThreadPool.java:72)
	at org.quartz.simpl.SimpleThreadPool$WorkerThread.run(SimpleThreadPool.java:520)
2011-11-23 23:42:05,314 QuartzWorker-0 WARN ServiceRunner    POP3 Service [com.atlassian.mail.MailUtils] Unable to extract text from MIME part with Content-Type 'application/msword;
	name="FINAL IDDI Manual September 2010 (2).doc"
{code}

Need a windows client machine. (eg: Windows 7 in testing)
And possibly an Exchange server, I'm not sure if other mail servers will have the same fault. They may format the pop3 response differently...


h5. Reproduction Method:

From Windows 7
# Create a dummy document (eg) test.docx
# Right-click test.docx, select Send to | Mail recipient. This should open an email window.
# Add the recipient (eg, in our case) Jira
# Add the issue tag to the subject line, eg, [JIR-484]
# Delete all message content
# Send

h5. Note:
It's the absence of a main message body that causes the problem.

Using Outlook and deleting the message body did not produce a blocked email. Presumably, Outlook puts a bit of "empty" html in the message body. Unsure what other mail clients would be able to produce a "bad" message - would need to do plain text, with and empty message and an attachment.

The service is configured like this:

{code}
Our mail set up uses the POP3 service in a comment only mode with the regex comment splitter:
usessl: No SSL
popserver: DHHS-POP3-jira.issues
handler.params: reporterusername=jiraadmin, createusers=false, splitregex="===|\s*_*\s*From: JIRA (by:", bulk=delete
forwardEmail: youremailaddress@atlassian.com
handler: Regex Comment Handler
{code}

This basically splits off:
# anything after a === character sequence (people put this in their signature at the chop point to remove history, etc) and
# the jira notification so people can reply to notifications with a quick comment.
fields.summary: POP3 comments with no body and only attachment get stuck in mail queue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-26460].
  {panel}

Hi 

I pretty well understand why a [Plugins Policy|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Atlassian+OnDemand+Plugin+Policy] was introduced in the JIRA OnDemand. Stability and security are the problems that prevent you from allowing to install JIRA plugins into OnDemand.

However, I also pretty well understand that it's possible to isolate environments in which different OnDemand instances run to make sure one client will not ruin the other client's systems. Virtualisation fully solves that. So it's possible to solve inter-environment stability and security issues.

Stability & security issues at user's own instance are just a matter of sending a clear message to OnDemand customers, saying - "we carry no responsibility for thirdparty plugins problems". As long as you allow to install plugins onto the downloaded solution - you are allowing users to ruin themselves in their own selfhosted instances. I don't see then why not allow same thing for Atlassian hosted environment, as long as this will not affect other customers. It will bring major benefit of plugins exchange to OnDemand users. 

Thanks
Alex

PS: I've found no paticular project for OnDemand system, so posting to main JIRA project. Please lead me to OnDemand dedicated space, as I have more to post for it.
fields.summary: allow plugins for JIRA OnDemand

fields.description:
h3. Summary

We have our Jira instance setup to synchronize with Active Directory such that any users that are added to a particular AD group are supposed to automatically become Jira users. When we initially configured the user directory, the synchronization worked perfectly and all users were able to login to Jira. However, when a new user joined the AD group, it is not automatically created in JIRA.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

The following LDAP User Filter is used on the User Directory:

{noformat}
"ldap.user.filter": "(&(objectCategory=Person)(memberOf=CN=newgrp,CN=Users,DC=company,DC=local))"
{noformat}

h3. Expected Results

All the users that are members of the _newgrp_ after the synchronization are automatically added to the _jira-users_ group.

h3. Actual Results

For the first time the directory is synchronized, everything works fine. However, if a user is added to the _newgrp_ directory after the first synchronization, it is not automatically added to Jira, instead we can see this message in the atlassian-jira.log:

{noformat}
2011-12-06 10:05:41,016 QuartzWorker-1 WARN ServiceRunner     [atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteChangeOperations] Could not add the following missing users to group [ newgrp ]: [johndoe]
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

The workaround for this situation is to go into your Advanced Settings in your user Directory and uncheck "Enable Incremental Synchronization" as per [Connecting to an LDAP Directory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+to+an+LDAP+Directory#ConnectingtoanLDAPDirectory-AdvancedSettings].
fields.summary: Synchronization of users that are added to a particular AD group that is configured to automatically become JIRA users doesn't work after the initial synch

When a user currently logs back in after a session timeout by clicking on a link to an attachment, the login screen comes up and allows the user to log in and the attachment is downable, but the url is not redirected to the dashboard, it stays at the login screen. Can we change this so that the user is directed to their dashboard as they normally would when they login?

To reproduce:

1. Login to Jira
2. Open an existing ticket which has as an attachment(In my case I had an excel file attached to the ticket)
3. Keep the page open until the session gets timed out
4. After the session has been timed out, click on the attachment present to the ticket
5. User would be redirected to Login Page
6. Enter credentials and click on Login Button
7. User would still be on Login page only. How ever the attachment has been downloaded.
8. Hit the Login button again and notice that the attachment would be downloaded again. But user would still be on Login Page.
9. Try to refresh the page. Attachment would be downloaded again. But user would be still on Login Page

The url displayed is:

http://jiraserver:8080/login.jsp?permissionViolation=true&os_destination=%2Fsecure%2Fattachment%2F18351%2FWorkbook1.xlsx
fields.summary: Redirect to dashboard after logging in after session timeout when trying to download an attachment

fields.description:
After specifying a release date of a project, upon viewing the versions in the Project Road Map, the date displayed will not be consistent with the date specified when creating the version.
- In the manage version screen
!scshot1.png!
- In the Project Road Map
!scshot2.png!

Steps to reproduce:
- Deploy JIRA 4.4 or above
- Change the user timezone setting (example, default timezone is GMT +8, change the user timezone to GMT +0)
- Create a Version, and specify the release date
- Go to the project Road Map, and we can see that the release date is displayed a day earlier than the exact date specified

It seems that the release date is following the server timezone setting, instead of the user timezone configured in the UI. This however, may cause confusion and complication to the users that has different timezone setting. 

When specifying a release date of a project, it seems that the date will be auto adjusted based on the user timezone settings.
fields.summary: Inconsistent Version Release Date in the Project Road Map

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-26445].
  {panel}

We have the Greenhopper/Agile plugin on our Jira. On the Issue Navigator, through Tools > Configure Columns I added the "Story Points" column. It appears in the "Re-order columns" view and I can see populated values.

When I click back to "Issue Navigator", the column is missing. But, if I filter on *all* issue types (i.e. ensure every issue type in the list is selected) - the story points column magically appears. If I search with just "Any" issue type selected however, the Story Points column vanishes again. As far as I can tell, the column is visible whenever I choose any issue type other than "Any" - so just choosing 'standard issue types' also makes the column visible.

In JQL:
works - I can see "Story Points" column with any of these examples:
{code}
issuetype in standardIssueTypes()
issuetype in ("New Feature", epic)
{code}

A blank JQL query however (equivalent to "Any" issue type) does not work - I cannot see "Story Points" column.

It also seems to hide the column if my filter does not select any issue types (such as epic or story) that have stories. So for example, if I filter on "New Feature" or "Bug", it does not show the story points column. That seems reasonable. It _does_ show the column if my filter includes both "New Feature" and Epic (see second JQL above), i.e. one issue type that has story points and one that does not - which is also good. However if I choose "Any" issue type, that should include any Epics and Stories and show the associated story points. (it should certainly give the same results as when I individually select all of the possible issue types).

Additionally, this also affects the 'Export'>>'Excel (All fields)'.  The 'Story Points' field will not be exported if it is not displayed in the issue navigator.  If you adjust the JQL to {code}"Story Points" is not EMPTY{code} the export functionality will function as expected.
fields.summary: Visibility of column in issue navigator is different depending on whether I choose "Any" issue type, or select all the issue types.

This issue directly relates to JRA-24558, which has been marked fixed for JIRA 4.4.3.

After some testing with the new release, I found that filters and dashboards are still not recognized.  Issues, however, have been fixed.

*Reproduce* (*NOTE TO TESTER*: Please read https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-26441?focusedCommentId=301427&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-301427)
* Create a user with username "testuser"
* Login with username "testuser"
* Create a new issue filter and a new personal dashboard
* Inside the LDAP directory, create a username "TestUser"

fields.description:
CVS commits are not shown in 'Version Control' tab for the specific JIRA issue in spite of the fact that CVS logs were successfully retrieved by VCS Update Service, stored into file on file system and contain logs marked with JIRA issue key in it.

Steps to reproduce:
1) Create necessary CVS module, turn on automatic log retrieval, set file on local file system to store CVS logs
2) Link JIRA project to CVS Module created in step 1
3) Create JIRA issue in project from step 2.
4) Commit files into CVS repository (which is handled by CVS module from step 1.) under any branch with log message which contains JIRA key of issue created in step 3.
5) Restart JIRA or wait for VCS Update Service running
6) Check CVS log file and make sure that it contains log message with JIRA issue key (step 4.)
7) Open JIRA issue, open 'Version Control' tab and see there the following text: "No commits have yet been performed on this issue."

How I met this problem: Yesterday I committed file into CVS for specific JIRA issue and added key of this issue into commit log. Then I found out that my JIRA project is not linked to CVS module so I didn't see anything in 'Version Control' tab. After that I linked my project to proper CVS module and restarted JIRA, waited for the updating of all CVS log files and checked 'Version Control' tab. It showed me all my committed files. I was very happy! But today I've checked this tab for that JIRA issue and haven't seen anything in it only message with text "No commits have yet been performed on this issue.". There were no any additional restarts of JIRA, CVS module changes, errors in JIRA logs between two moments when I committed file into CVS and when I checked 'Version Control' tab and didn't find anything there.

I'm attaching two screenshots:
 1) First screenshot with content of CVS log file and JIRA issue key
 2) Second screenshot with JIRA issue's empty 'Version Control' tab
fields.summary: CVS commits are not shown in 'Version Control' tab

fields.description:
An error occurs when you try to Resolve or Close an issue then cancel out when you're in the Issue Navigator. After canceling out of the popup menu, if you try to resolve or close another item, the pop-up menu still is performing actions on the first issue your tried to resolve or close. 

It looks like this occurs only on Resolve and Close. All other actions that yield a pop-up menu still try and perform the action on the correct issue.

Steps to reproduce:
# Populate a list of results in the Issue Navigator
# Click on the Actions cog on the line of an Issue then click Resolve
# Cancel out of Menu and click Resolve on another item
** You'll see that the issue that is being resolved is the original issue that you were going to resolve first.
** Each the Resolve and Close are independent of each other. Resolve, Cancel, Resolve will show the same ticket. Same for Close, Cancel, Close.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-26413].
  {panel}

When AD is selected the "Enable Incremental Synchronisation" option appears in "Advanced Settings". We don't document this option.

We need to document this option. We also need to mention that this option only works when the user configured for the synchronisation has:

# Read access to the {{uSNChanged}} attribute on all the users and groups in the directory that need to be synchronised.
# Read access to the objects and attributes in the Deleted Objects container (http://support.microsoft.com/kb/892806).

If either of these is not true you may end up with added (deleted) AD users not being added (deleted) in JIRA. See http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/YAfuDw.

REF: CWD-2713, CWD-2714
fields.summary: The LDAP configuration documentation does not document "Enable Incremental Synchronisation:" AD option.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-26411].
  {panel}

We have a periodic problem in user search where a user cannot be found due to a limited 20-hit match list, commmon names, spelling variations and a large user base (e.g. us, 15000 potential users in ldap database.)

Example: Attempting to add David Smith as watcher. (This is a real example.)
1. Type *david* - too many matches
2. Type *smith* - too many matches
3. Type *dsmith* - no hit, his username is dpsmith3
4. Type *david.smith*, attempting an email match - no hit, this sometimes works for us but here his  mail address has been disambiguated to david.p.smith@xxx.  

This can also happen where there are variations of names, eg, deb/debra, or alternate spellings.  Using a broader target gives too may hits to pick the user but a narrow search misses altogether.

Suggested fixes:
1. Use a *dot* for an AND search, so _david.smith_ requires a match on _david_ and _smith_ (y)  
2. Allow scrolling/paging of the full hit list.
3. All the above.

Option 1 is the snappiest from a usability point of view but paging is probably easier to understand.  A hint "Displaying 20 of 237 matching users. (+Search Tips+)" on an overflowing picklist would be great.
fields.summary: Improved user searches for large user bases

fields.description:
tl;dr: if a page with an admin decorator is hooked to a project admin plugin point (either a tab, or in the Actions menu), it tries to render a project admin specific header

I recently tried to implement a project admin UI that fits in well with the recent Ignite UI changes in my issue collector plugin.  This is a lot harder than one might think!

The bug in particular I'm raising here is that the header web-panel for the project admin decorator expectes the project to be set in ProjectConfigRequestCache.  This however only gets set if you go through the project admin PanelServlet.  If I'm merely using the project admin decorator by including the correct meta tags in my page then the project doesn't get set in the ProjectConfigRequestCache and you get an IllegalStateException and massive stack trace in the logs any time your project admin page is rendered.  We should fix this so that the project gets picked up via meta tags and doesn't have to be set by the PanelServlet!
fields.summary: Implementing a project admin UI in a plugin is broken

  {panel}

Please mention checking  *Allow users to vote on issues = on* inside of JIRA General Configuration when setting up voting inside of JIRA.

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA044/Watching+and+Voting+on+an+Issue

The following has helped previously in guiding when voting was not available:
1. Login to JIRA.
2. In the administration, go to "General Configuration".
3. Set the "Allow users to vote on issues" to "on".
4. Please retry that voting process.

fields.description:
Security auditing tests performed on a *Jira Bug Issue and Project Tracking Software* locally running instance shown that the application is succeptible to horizontal privilege elevation attacks within the *Resolve Issue* feature, accessible through the given address:

* [jira/secure/WorkflowUIDispatcher.jspa?id=61449&action=5&atl_token=A816-FTT5-H1WF-I743|988d36060a652b393a97ec6b1c30d41204c86909|lin]

The vulnerability enables for a user to view the *ISSUEKEY* and *TITLE* of issues within projects he/she does not have permission to access.

When resolving an issue, the following window appears:

!01_resolveIssueScreen.png!

When the *resolve* button is clicked, the following request is generated:

!02_requisicaoOriginalGerada.png!

By incrementing the *ID* number in the aforementioned request, the user can access/view information within projects he doesn't have access to. The following image describes this scenario:

!03_exploracaoAtaque_ehpTitleIssuekey.png!

An important thing to mention is that in this case, not only the *ISSUEKEY* can be seen, but also, the *TITLE* of the issue is being leaked. Specifically in our case this becomes a significant problem, since the title of our issues eventually contain information such as:

* Server providing sensitive information through SNMP;
* Possible mySQL sweep;
* Server with deprecated version of Apache Tomcat;
* Microsoft IIS Internal IP Address Disclosure Vulnerability;
* PHPMyAdmin accessible without the need for authentication.

This information can be associated with the ISSUEKEY to point out the client. In other words, an attacker may be able to acknowledge the *VULNERABILITY* of a *CLIENT* within Jira --- which is our front-end for communicating with the user regarding their vulnerabilities.
fields.summary: Issue key can be enumerated - Resolve Issue Feature

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-26375].
  {panel}

Incorrect Exception message thrown, which misleads users.

Also see
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-3325

The Exception thrown when entering a permission related workflow step variable looks like following:
{code}
java.lang.RuntimeException: Error parsing meta attribute <meta name='jira.permission.edit'>false</meta>. Name format is 'jira.permission.[subtasks].<permission>.[group|user|assignee|...]'
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] java.lang.RuntimeException: Error parsing meta attribute <meta name='jira.permission.edit'>false</meta>. Name format is 'jira.permission.[subtasks].<permission>.[group|user|assignee|...]'
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at com.atlassian.jira.permission.WorkflowPermissionFactory.createWorkflowPermission(WorkflowPermissionFactory.java:81)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at com.atlassian.jira.permission.WorkflowPermissionFactory.getWorkflowPermissions(WorkflowPermissionFactory.java:41)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at com.atlassian.jira.security.WorkflowBasedPermissionManager.hasPermission(WorkflowBasedPermissionManager.java:75)
{code}

The user mistook the format (jira.permission.[subtasks].<permission>.[group|user|assignee|...]) for a pseudo regex, and thought subtask as well as the last part were optional, where only the subtask in fact is. According to the documentation

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA044/Workflow+Properties

which links to

http://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/latest/com/atlassian/jira/security/WorkflowBasedPermissionManager.html

the correct format is 'jira.permission.[subtasks.]\{permission}.\{type}\[.suffix]'

Please adapt the Exception message accordingly.

*Scenario 2:*
We have tested to add the workflow property and reproducible in JIRA 4.4.5, 5.0.7, 5.1.8 and 5.2.11:
* jira.permission.work = denied

It looks like the property is doing it's job, and the log work feature will be disable for that specific issue status.

*Steps to reproduce*
# Go to {{Administration > Workflows}}
# Edit the related workflow, and create a draft workflow if required
# Go to any of the workflow step (not transition!), open the property for that workflow step
# Add the following property:
{noformat}
jira.permission.work = denied
{noformat}

*Finding:*
Though the property seems to work, it looks like apparently we managed to reproduce the problem as well. In our test setup, the log work is disabled in the In Progress step due to the property, but when we try to resolve the issue, we get the following error:
{noformat}
2013-05-23 22:24:21,341 http-bio-8081-exec-11 ERROR admin 1344x11961x1 1lif4su 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/IssueAction!default.jspa [atlassian.jira.permission.WorkflowPermissionFactory] Error parsing meta attribute <meta name='jira.permission.work'>denied</meta>. Name format is 'jira.permission.[subtasks].<permission>.[group|user|assignee|...]'
2013-05-23 22:24:21,342 http-bio-8081-exec-11 ERROR admin 1344x11961x1 1lif4su 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/IssueAction!default.jspa [atlassian.plugin.web.DefaultWebInterfaceManager] Could not evaluate condition 'com.atlassian.plugin.web.conditions.AndCompositeCondition@63e5635f' for descriptor: com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issueoperations:log-work (null)
java.lang.RuntimeException: Error parsing meta attribute <meta name='jira.permission.work'>denied</meta>. Name format is 'jira.permission.[subtasks].<permission>.[group|user|assignee|...]'
	at com.atlassian.jira.permission.WorkflowPermissionFactory.createWorkflowPermission(WorkflowPermissionFactory.java:81)
	at com.atlassian.jira.permission.WorkflowPermissionFactory.getWorkflowPermissions(WorkflowPermissionFactory.java:41)
	at com.atlassian.jira.security.WorkflowBasedPermissionManager.hasPermission(WorkflowBasedPermissionManager.java:75)
	at com.atlassian.jira.security.AbstractPermissionManager.hasPermission(AbstractPermissionManager.java:113)
	at com.atlassian.jira.security.AbstractPermissionManager.hasPermission(AbstractPermissionManager.java:142)  <+2> (DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
{noformat}
fields.summary: Workflow permission variable misconfiguration Exception message is misleading
